html.p: What: Only keep and use what you need

ol.li: fields returns only the fields you specify, and removes the rest from the working data set
Use fields anywhere in the SPL to slim down the data set
It's okay to use fields multiple times in the same SPL
fields can keep [+] or remove [-] the field list presented

html.p: Why: Nuke unnecessary fields in data, keep the fields you need
So What: Return results faster, clean up output, save memory and processing resources, and don't confuse with table.
The data we are using for this command: | index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h

panel.title: Return all the fields
panel.html: Note the data size and duration to run. Everything after fields is used to calculate the size of the data set returned. Also we're using table to make a point. :)

search.query: index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h | table component group | eval size=len(_raw) | stats sum(size) as datasize | eval datasize=tostring(datasize, "commas")

panel.title: Now let's ask for only the fields we care about
panel.html: Note the data size and duration to run. Note that everything after fields is used to calculate the size of the data set returned.

search.query: index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h | fields component group | eval size=len(component)+len(group) | stats sum(size) as datasize | eval datasize=tostring(datasize, "commas")
